thread.title: Police defend use of Taser on city official in Texas
thread.title_full: Police defend use of Taser on city official in Texas - San Francisco Chronicle

title: Police defend use of Taser on city official in Texas
text: Photo: Brandon Woodson, AP This image made from a video provided by Brandon Woodson and taken Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, shows a police encounter with Prairie View City Council Member Jonathan Miller in Prairie View, Texas. Police officials are defending the decision to use a stun gun on Miller when he intervened as officers questioned his friends outside his apartment. Miller, at a Monday, Oct. 12, news conference, said he was vouching for his friends and telling officers they were doing nothing wrong. (Brandon Woodson via AP) This image made from a video provided by Brandon Woodson and taken... PRAIRIE VIEW, Texas (AP) — Police officials in a small, predominantly black Texas college town are defending the decision to use a stun gun on a City Council member when he intervened as officers questioned his friends outside his apartment. This image made from a video provided by Brandon Woodson and taken Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, shows a police encounter with Prairie View City Council Member Jonathan Miller in Prairie View, Texas. Police officials are defending the decision to use a stun gun on Miller when he intervened as officers questioned his friends outside his apartment. Miller, at a Monday, Oct. 12, news conference, said he was vouching for his friends and telling officers they were doing nothing wrong. (Brandon Woodson via AP) This image made from a video provided by Brandon Woodson and taken... PRAIRIE VIEW, Texas (AP) — Police officials in a small, predominantly black Texas college town are defending the decision to use a stun gun on a City Council member when he intervened as officers questioned his friends outside his apartment.
